definition: KGB (Soviet secret police)/member of the KGB
abbr. for 克羅地亞|克罗地亚[Ke4 luo2 di4 ya4], Croatia/(Tw) abbr. for 克羅埃西亞|克罗埃西亚[Ke4 luo2 ai1 xi1 ya4], Croatia
square/frame/rule/(legal) case/style/character/standard/pattern/(grammar) case/(classical) to obstruct/to hinder/(classical) to arrive/to come/(classical) to investigate/to study exhaustively
flourishing/prosperous/suddenly/abruptly

sentences.english: This suspicion tainted the KGB careers of all four.
sentences.chinese: 這一懷疑污染了四個人爲克格勃所做的工作。

sentences.english: My old friends at KGB despise the GRU.
sentences.chinese: 我在克格勃的老朋友們都很鄙視格勒烏。

sentences.english: The interrogating KGB officer pushes me against a filing cabinet.
sentences.chinese: 負責審訊的克格勃官員把我推進了檔案室。

sentences.english: The KGB officer had just returned from Africa, and he had brought a small telescope.
sentences.chinese: 那位克格勃官員剛從非洲回來，帶了一個小型望遠鏡。

sentences.english: Free of all KGB connections, he fits the profile of the modern technocrat.
sentences.chinese: 他沒有克格勃聯繫，符合現代技術官僚的輪廓。

sentences.english: The KGB never had anything like it.
sentences.chinese: 克格勃可從來沒有這種東西。
